title: A tribute to maharajas of Rajasthan
caption: A tribute to maharajas of Rajasthan
desc: Today, on Rajasthan Day, we take you to the Gaitore Cenotaphs of the state – a series of 20 domes or ‘chhatris’ built at the cremation sites of maharajas who once ruled the region.  The most famous of these - and the oldest – is the marble cenotaph of Raja Jai Singh II. Its dome has sculptures representing 18 apsaras and gandharvas (nymphs and celestial musicians).
copyright: View from the Gaitore Cenotaphs near Jaipur, Rajasthan (© Gekkon/Shutterstock)
